newsitem.title: USA: Registry tumbles more on Renaissance deal.
newsitem.headline: Registry tumbles more on Renaissance deal.

text.p: Shares of Registry Inc extended losses in late morning trading despite company assertions that the proposed acquisition of Renaissance Solutions Inc would create new opportunities in the information technology consulting industry.

The steep decline eroded the value of the stock deal which was originally pegged at $430 million, or $45.20 per share. By late morning, the deal was worth $370 million, or $38.20 per share, based on the Registry stock price.
By late morning, Registry was down 8-1/4 to 48-1/4. Reniassance gained 2-1/4 to 37, still below the bid price.

Wall Street offered little explanation of the reason behind the decline. Participants on a morning conference call praised the proposed transaction, which will combine Registry's role of implementing information technology solutions with Renaissance's focus on design and development.

One analyst who did not want to be identified speculated the decline could be linked to views that Registry may be paying too much for Renaissance or that few cost savings would be associated with the transaction. However, he viewed the transaction as extremely positive, noting that "people don't really understand what's going on here."
